info.title: Member APIs
info.description:
**Member** is a Loyalty Management System (LMS) that enables marketers to create multiple loyalty strategies under a loyalty program to cater to various businesses and customer segments.
**Member overview**:
During onboarding, you are given the necessary **credentials** (client_id and client_secret) to obtain an access token, which is required to run every call. Membership hierarchy is organized into Programs, Clubs, and Tiers.
**Program** is the first hierarchy level and is where rewards and benefits are configured for the organization.
**Club** is the second hierarchy level and is where Rules for the program are configured.
Each Club must have at least one **Tier**, which is used to define membership and to configure criteria and thresholds (including free vs paid). Additional hierarchy levels can be added to support the needs of your business.
Members are always enrolled into a **Default Tier** within a club. When members make purchases, they earn Points based on the rules set at the club level and/or based on promotions. When points in a member account reach a predefined **Threshold Value**, points are converted to **Rewards**. This conversion may be manual or automatic depending on the program configuration. Members can **Redeem** their rewards within the reward **Expiry Period**. Account point balances are updated after each point-impacting activity.

servers.description: For developers to work outside of the production environment.
Replica of the production environment for testing.
An isolated testing environment (UAT) to run programs without affecting the application, system or platform on which they run.

post.description:
After setting up your loyalty program with fabric, the next crucial step is to enroll members to the program. This endpoint enrolls a loyalty member into a default tier associated with a club.
**Note**: Only a single member can be enrolled at a time.

put.description:
Updates details of an existing member.
**Note**: Only a single member can be updated at a time.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of all members of a parent company. The results can be narrowed down by using the query parameters. By specifying the loyaltyNumber or the profileId as query parameter, you can get details of a single member.
**Note**:
1) Member must be already part of the loyalty program.
2) The query parameter used to get results must be part of member information.

parameters.name: loyaltyNumber
parameters.description: Loyalty number of the member. Either the loyaltyNumber or the profileId must be specified. It is generated in the response of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /v1/members/.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Profile ID of the member. Either the loyaltyNumber or the profileId must be specified. It is generated in the response of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /v1/members/.

parameters.name: redemptionChoice
parameters.description: Redemption choice. Supported options are Bank and Auto. If the redemptionChoice is 'auto,' the points are automatically converted to rewards. When the redemptionChoice is 'bank,' the points are converted to rewards at the member’s requests.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: First name of the member.

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Middle name of the member.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Last name of the member.

parameters.name: phonenumber
parameters.description: Phone number given for enrollment (without space or dash).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address given for enrollment.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of member.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Postal code of the address.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: City name

parameters.name: countryName
parameters.description: Country name

parameters.name: countryAbbreviation
parameters.description: Abbreviation of the country name.

parameters.name: regionName
parameters.description: State name

parameters.name: regionAbbreviation
parameters.description: Abbreviation of the state name.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting number of record (within the total number of records) in the response. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ending number of record (from the offset number) in the response. Default value is 20.

post.description: Updates the status of the points from Pending to Active. When setToPending flag is true, the duration in which the points will be in Pending status must be specified between 0-24 hours. When it is 0, the endpoint must be run manually (otherwise, the points earned will remain in Pending status). When the duration is between 1-24 hours, the points stay in Pending status only for the defined period. This endpoint can be configured to run automatically to activate the points. **Note**: Points in the Pending status reflect in the account balance but they can be redeemed only after they reach the defined threshold value and is in Active status.

Allows points adjustment by adding or deducting points from the member’s loyalty account.
**Note**:
1) The daily cap for adjustment is configurable as per the role requirements.
2) Point adjustments are recorded as a transaction, where a pre-defined reason code must be selected.

Earns and accumulates points based on core (earn and burn) rules, promotional rules, etc. set at the club level. It is possible, for instance, to set rules that a member will earn 10 points for every $100 spent in a purchase transaction, and 10 points are equivalent to $2. The rules are customizable based on the requirement.
Points are categorized as:
1) Base points - Earned in any purchase transaction based on the core rule.
2) Bonus points - Earned as a bonus for example on a large purchase.
3) Promotional Points - Earned as part of promotional events.
4) Restricted Points - Points to be used only on specified stores.

The Earn API uses the following formula for validating Payload:
1) Amount Paid = Gross Amount - Discounts
2) Net Amount = Gross Amount - Taxes - Discounts
3) At the Transaction Item level: Item Price - (Discount/Quantity) = Net Amount / Quantity
4) Total of all Transaction Items' Gross Amount = Total Gross Amount

get.description: Retrieves transactions based on the limit (default: 20) and offset (default: 0) values. This endpoint serves to populate the transaction listing page and as a search function based on the query parameters such as date range, transaction ID, etc.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: The profile ID of the member. In an ecosystem, it acts as a primary ID to keep the various systems (apps, websites, etc.) in sync. The profileId is generated as part of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /members.

parameters.name: startTimestampUTC
parameters.description: The start date of the selected date range, in UTC format.

parameters.name: endTimestampUTC
parameters.description: The end date of the selected date range, in UTC format.

parameters.name: transactionExternalReference
parameters.description: External reference (name or ID) of the transaction like POS Order Id or Ecommerce Order Id.

parameters.name: transactionType
parameters.description: The field refers to the different type of transaction activities on a member account such as Earn Transaction, Burn Transaction, Earn Reverse Transaction and so on

parameters.name: transactionCode
parameters.description: Transaction Code

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Indicates the starting record number (within the total number of records) in the response. When no value is provided, the default value is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Indicates the final record number (from the offset number) in the response. When no value is provided, the default value is 20.

post.description: When a member cancels a purchase transaction or returns an order, this endpoint cancels all the points earned in that transaction.

Issues a reward certificate based on the member's request or when the points in the member's account reach a configurable threshold.
**Note** - A single reward is issued at a time.
When the redemptionChoice is set to 'auto', the points are automatically converted to rewards. When the redemptionChoice is 'bank,' the points are converted based on the member's request.
The response of this endpoint includes a redemptionCode, which is required to redeem the reward in the future.

Confirms the redemption and marks the reward as used. This is done based on the redemptionCode that is generated from the response of the 'Issue Variable Rewards' - POST /api/v1/redeem/reward/issue endpoint.
**Note**:
1) Rewards have to be issued before they can be redeemed.
2) Rewards must be within their expiration date.

get.description:
Gets status-wise (Active, Cancelled, Redeemed, Reversed, etc.) details of all the rewards of a member.
**Note**: When the profileId query-param is not specified, this endpoint retrieves all rewards for all members of a company.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: A member's unique profileId, generated in the response of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /v1/members.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ending number of the record (from the offset number) in the response. When no value is provided, the default value is 20.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The starting number of the record (within the total number of records) in the response. When no value is provided, the default value is 0.

post.description:
Converts rewards back to points when the order is cancelled or returned.
**Note**: Once a reward has been redeemed, it cannot be cancelled. To cancel the rewards (convert back to points) before redemption, use the ‘Cancel Reward’ endpoint - POST /api/v1/redeem/cancel.

Loyalty points that are converted into reward certificates have an expiration date. Members can cancel their rewards if they are unable to use them before expiration or do not want to use them. The endpoint converts the rewards back into points, for future use.
**Note**: Once the reward is redeemed, it cannot be cancelled. If the member cancels or returns an order, the rewards are reversed back to points using the ‘Reverse Redeemed Reward’ endpoint - POST v1/redeem/reverse.

Retrieves applicable discounts for a transaction. The discounts are categorized as
1) **Transaction-level discounts**: Applied on the whole transaction. For example, if the transaction is for $100, the discount is applied by percentage or amount to the whole transaction amount. This category includes tier-specific discounts.
2) **Item-level discounts**: Applied on specific SKU so that discount percentage or amount is applied to specific product (regardless of the quantity).
3) **Miscellaneous discounts** - This category captures all other types of discounts.

get.description: Retrieves all active and pending (excluding expired) member points along with the points breakdown.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Profile ID. It is generated in the response of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /v1/members.

get.description:
Retrieves the redeemable points of a member on a given entity.
When points in the member account reach a defined threshold value, the points are converted to rewards, which can be redeemed in the future purchases.
**Note**: The points to rewards conversion may be manual or automatic depending on how it is configured.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Profile ID. It is generated in the response of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /v1/members.

parameters.name: ehtId
parameters.description: Entity Hierarchy Tree (EHT) ID. Either the EHT ID or the clubExternalReference must be specified along with the profileID.

parameters.name: externalReference
parameters.description: External reference number of the entity/store.

parameters.name: clubExternalReference
parameters.description: External reference number of the club.

get.description: Retrieves reason codes and reason descriptions based on the actions defined for your business. This serves as a log for tracking and analysis. As an example, an action such as 'points transfer' has a specific code for it and a description such as 'transferring to relative' associated with it. In addition to the predefined actions, custom actions can be added.

Retrieve all the point types configured for your business. The point types are categorized as:
1) Base points - Earned in any purchase transaction based on the core rule.
2) Bonus points - Earned as a bonus for example on a large purchase.
3) Promotional Points - Earned as part of promotional events.
4) Restricted Points - Points to be used only on specific entity/stores.
**Note**: You may choose only the point types that apply to your business.
Retrieves all points that will expire within a year starting at 30 days, 60 days, and up to one year.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Profile ID. It is generated in the response of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /v1/members.

get.description: Retrieves expired points of a member for a date range, in UTC format. When date range is not specified, all the expired points are retrieved

parameters.description: ProfileId of the member, which is generated in the response of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /v1/members.

tierReference.description:
Tiers are always setup at the club level and a number of tiers can be created. Tiers are categorized as Free (Predefined names are Bronze, Silver, Gold) and Paid (Example - Pro).
**Note**: The tier names and the rules to move up and down the tiers are configurable. In addition, points, rewards, and tier expiration can be setup at the tier level.

pointType.title: Pointtype
pointType.description:
Points type.
They are categorized as:
1) Base points - Earned in any purchase transaction, based on the core rule.
2) Bonus points - Earned as a bonus for example on a large purchase.
3) Promotional Points - Earned as part of promotional events.
4) Restricted Points - Points to be used only on specified stores.

reasonCode.description: Reason code for the point adjustment.

setToPending.title: Settopending
setToPending.description:
true: Points in Pending status.
false: Points in Active status.
**Note**:The time period for Pending state is configurable.

grossAmount.title: Grossamount
grossAmount.description: Gross amount of the item, before discount application.

totalAmountPaid.title: Totalamountpaid
totalAmountPaid.description: Amount paid for the item, including tax

netAmount.title: Netamount
netAmount.description: Total amount of the item without tax, and after item-discount application.

SKU.title: Sku
SKU.description: Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), a unique identifier of the item.

lineNumber.title: Linenumber
lineNumber.description: Line number of the item in the purchase order.

profileId.title: Profileid
profileId.description: Profile ID of the member. In an ecosystem, it acts as a primary ID to keep the various systems (apps, websites, etc.) in sync.

entityReference.description: Name or ID for the store (or entity) where the transaction took place.

transactionTypeExternalReference.title: Transactiontypeexternalreference
transactionTypeExternalReference.description: External reference for the transaction type such as purchase, return, or exchange (Configurable as per requirement).

activityTimestamp.title: Activitytimestamp
activityTimestamp.description: Activity date (in UTC format). An activity could be enrolling a member, making a transaction, etc.

transactionExternalReference.title: Transactionexternalreference
transactionExternalReference.description: Order ID or receipt ID for a transaction (received from the store). It is needed to cancel or return an order.

transactionGrossAmount.title: Transactiongrossamount
transactionGrossAmount.description: Gross transaction amount (in currency unit) of the total items earn. For example the gross amount of item1 is 50.00 and gross amount of item2 is 100.00. The transactionGrossAmount is 150.00.

checkForDuplicateTransaction.title: Checkforduplicatetransaction
checkForDuplicateTransaction.description: 0 indicates the system allows duplicates and 1 indicates there is a validation in place to identity duplicate.

fetchUpdatedMemberPointTotals.title: Fetchupdatedmemberpointtotals
fetchUpdatedMemberPointTotals.description: 1 indicates the total points are calculated and shown to the member. 0 indicates the total points are not calculated and the member is only notified the earn is successful. **Note**: The response is faster when the value is 0 because the total points are not calculated on the fly.

totalAmountPaid.title: Totalamountpaid
totalAmountPaid.description: Total amount paid for the items. For example, the amount paid for item1 is 100.00 and the amount of item2 is 200.00 so the total amount paid is 300.00.

discountValue.title: Discountvalue
discountValue.description: Discount value on the transaction, if applicable.

totalTax.title: Totaltax
totalTax.description: Total tax based on the number of items in the transaction. For example, the tax amount of item1 is 2.00 and tax amount of item2 is 1.00. The totalTax is 3.00.

netAmount.title: Netamount
netAmount.description: Net transaction amount based on the total items in the transaction, after subtracting taxes and discounts.

issueAuditUser.title: Issueaudituser
issueAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who issued the earn transaction.

cancelAuditUser.title: Cancelaudituser
cancelAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who cancelled the earn transaction.

redemptionCode.description: Redemption code to identify and link the rewards used in a specific transaction. This is generated in the response of the 'Issue Variable Rewards' endpoint - POST /api/v1/redeem/reward/issue.

reasonCode.title: Reasoncode
reasonCode.description: Reason code to categorize transactions. A parent company can configure custom codes for their stores as required.

reasonDescription.title: Reasondescription
reasonDescription.description: When reason codes are not configured, store can make use of the reason description to add notes on the transaction.

discounts.description: Represents the discounts on the item.

transactionItems.description: Details of the items in the transaction.

true: Points in Pending status
false: Points in Active status.
**Note**:The time period for Pending state is configurable.

reasonDescription.title: Reasondescription
reasonDescription.description: The reason for this transaction, if any

deviceId.title: Deviceid
deviceId.description: ID of the Device used to capture the transaction

issueAuditUser.title: Issueaudituser
issueAuditUser.description: The name of the representative who issued the transaction.

cancelAuditUser.title: Cancelaudituser
cancelAuditUser.description: The name of the representative who cancelled the transaction.

grossAmount.title: Grossamount
grossAmount.description: The gross amount of the item, before discount.

taxAmount.title: Taxamount
taxAmount.description: The tax amount of the item.

totalAmountPaid.title: Totalamountpaid
totalAmountPaid.description: The amount paid for the item

netAmount.title: Netamount
netAmount.description: The net amount of the item, after any item-level discounts.

items.description: The category name of the item.

SKU.title: Sku
SKU.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) of the item.

lineNumber.title: Linenumber
lineNumber.description: The line number of the item in the overall transaction.

grossAmount.description: The gross amount of the item, before discount.

taxAmount.title: Taxamount
taxAmount.description: The tax amount of the item.

netAmount.title: Netamount
netAmount.description: The net amount of the item, after any item-level discounts.

items.description: The category name of the item.

SKU.title: Sku

lineNumber.title: Linenumber
lineNumber.description: The line number of the item in the overall transaction.

EarnReverse.description: Transaction details to reverse the earned points

profileId.title: Profileid
profileId.description: The profile ID of the member. In an ecosystem, it acts as a primary ID to keep the various systems (apps, websites, etc.) in sync. The profileId is generated as part of the Enroll Member endpoint - POST /members.

entityReference.title: Entityreference
entityReference.description: A unique name or ID for the store (or entity) where the transaction took place.

reverseTransactionExternalRef.title: Reversetransactionexternalref
reverseTransactionExternalRef.description: External reference number of the transaction to reverse.

transactionTypeExternalReference.title: Transactiontypeexternalreference
transactionTypeExternalReference.description: The external reference for the transaction type such purchase, return, or exchange (configurable as per requirement).

activityTimestamp.title: Activitytimestamp
activityTimestamp.description: The activity date (in UTC format). An activity could be enrolling a member, making a transaction, etc.

transactionExternalReference.title: Transactionexternalreference
transactionExternalReference.description: The order ID or receipt ID for the transaction (received from the store). This is needed to cancel or return an order.

checkForDuplicateTransaction.title: Checkforduplicatetransaction
checkForDuplicateTransaction.description: 0 indicates the system allows duplicate and 1 indicates there is a validation in place to identify duplicates.

fetchUpdatedMemberPointTotals.title: Fetchupdatedmemberpointtotals
fetchUpdatedMemberPointTotals.description: A value of 1 indicates the total points (including the points earned in the latest transaction) are calculated and displayed to the member. A value of 0 indicates the total points are not calculated and the member is only notified if the earn is successful. The response is faster when the value is 0 because there is no calculations involved.

transactionGrossAmount.title: Transactiongrossamount
transactionGrossAmount.description: The gross amount on the transaction. For example, gross amount of item1 is 50.00 and gross amount of item2 is 100.00, then transactionGrossAmount is 150.00

discountValue.title: Discountvalue
discountValue.description: The discount amount applied on the transaction.

totalAmountPaid.title: Totalamountpaid
totalAmountPaid.description: Total amount paid for the items. For example, the amount paid for item1 is 100.00 and the amount of item2 is 200.00 so the total amount paid is 300.00.

totalTax.title: Totaltax
totalTax.description: Final tax amount based on the number of items in the transaction. Example - the tax amount of item1 is 2.00; Tax amount of item2 is 2.00. The totalTax is 4.00.

netAmount.title: Netamount
netAmount.description: The net transaction amount. Example - the net amount of item1 is 100.00 and net amount of item2 is 200.00. So, the netAmount is 300.00.

issueAuditUser.title: Issueaudituser
issueAuditUser.description: The name of the representative who issued the earn transaction.

cancelAuditUser.title: Cancelaudituser
cancelAuditUser.description: The name of the representative who cancelled the earn transaction.

redemptionCode.description: The redemption code used to identify and link the rewards used in a specific transaction. This code is generated in the response of the 'Issue Variable Rewards' endpoint - POST /api/v1/redeem/reward/issue.

setToPending.title: Settopending
setToPending.description:
true: Points in Pending status
false: Points in Active status. **Note**: The time period for Pending state is configurable.

reasonCode.title: Reasoncode
reasonCode.description: Reason code to categorize transactions. A parent company can configure custom codes for their stores as required.

reasonDescription.title: Reasondescription
reasonDescription.description: When reason codes are not configured, store can make use of the reason description.

transactionItems.description: Details of the transaction items to reverse.

isCompanyUser.title: Iscompanyuser
isCompanyUser.description:
true: Company user is running the endpoint
false: Client user is running the endpoint.

status.title: Status
status.description: Status code for the API call.

message.title: Message
message.description: Message corresponding to the status code.

errors.title: Errors
errors.description: In a successful response, this is always a blank object.

profileId.title: Profileid
profileId.description: Profile ID of the member. In an ecosystem, it acts as a primary ID to keep the various systems (apps, websites, etc.) in sync.

transactionNumber.title: Transactionnumber
transactionNumber.description: Transaction number. This is same as the transactionExternalReference and indicates a unique order ID or the receipt ID.

activityTimestamp.title: Activitytimestamp
activityTimestamp.description: Transaction activity time, in UTC format.

totalAmountPaid.title: Totalamountpaid
totalAmountPaid.description: Total amount paid for the items. For example, the amount paid for item1 is 100.00 and the amount of item2 is 200.00 so the total amount paid is 300.00.

totalTax.title: Totaltax
totalTax.description: Total tax applied on items eligible for earning points.

transactionNetAmount.title: Transactionnetamount
transactionNetAmount.description: Net total amount of the transaction.

points.title: points
points.description: Total points reversed in this transaction.

basePoints.title: Basepoints
basePoints.description: Base points reversed in this transaction

bonusPoints.title: Bonuspoints
bonusPoints.description: Bonus points reversed in this transaction

promotionalPoints.title: Promotionalpoints
promotionalPoints.description: Promotional points reversed in this transaction

currentPointsBalance.title: currentPointsBalance
currentPointsBalance.description: Points available in the member's account after this transaction.

reasonCode.title: Reasoncode
reasonCode.description: Reason code to categorize transactions. A parent company can configure custom codes for their stores as required.

reasonDescription.title: Reasondescription
reasonDescription.description: When reason codes are not configured, store can make use of the reason description to add notes on the transaction.

discountValue.title: Discountvalue
discountValue.description: The discount amount for this transaction.

transactionItems.description: Details of the reversed transaction items

issueAuditUser.title: Issueaudituser
issueAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who issued the earn transaction.

cancelAuditUser.title: Cancelaudituser
cancelAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who cancelled the earn transaction.

deviceId.title: Deviceid
deviceId.description: ID of the Device used to reverse the transaction

transactionType.title: Transactiontype
transactionType.description: This field specifies the type of transaction activity, ssuch as Earn Transaction, Burn Transaction, Earn Reverse Transaction and so on

transactionActivityType.title: Transactionactivitytype
transactionActivityType.description: An alias for the transactionType, configurable on a per-company basis

transactionTypeExternalReference.title: Transactiontypeexternalreference
transactionTypeExternalReference.description: External reference for the transaction type such as purchase, return, or exchange. Supports any string value as configured by the store.

transactionExternalReference.title: Transactionexternalreference
transactionExternalReference.description: Order ID or receipt ID for the transaction (received from the store). This is unique and needed to cancel or return an order.

transactionEntityReference.title: Transactionentityreference
transactionEntityReference.description: Reference to the entity where the transaction occurred

profileId.title: Profileid
profileId.description: Profile ID of the member. In an ecosystem, it acts as a primary ID to keep the various systems (apps, websites, etc.) in sync.

redemptionCode.title: Redemptioncode
redemptionCode.description: Redemption code. This code must be specified. It is used to identify and link the rewards used in a specific transaction. This code is generated in the response of the 'Issue Variable Rewards' endpoint - POST /api/v1/redeem/reward/issue.

cancelAuditUser.title: Cancelaudituser
cancelAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who cancelled the audit.

message.title: Message

data.description: Details of the points issued as reward.

rewardPointCost.description: Represents the ratio of dollar value of reward to the points consumed. E.g. a value of 0.5 indicates that 1 dollar redeemed consumed 2 points.

rewardValue.description: The number of points redeemed by the issuance of this reward.

redemptionCode.description: Redemption code. It uniquely identifies each reward object.

redemptionCode.title: Redemptioncode
redemptionCode.description: Redemption code. This code must be specified. The redemption code is generated in the response of the 'Issue Variable Rewards' (POST /api/v1/redeem/reward/issue) endpoint.

locationExternalReference.title: Locationexternalreference
locationExternalReference.description: Represents the store where the rewards are being redeemed. Each store (online, physical or POS) has a unique locationExternalReference name or ID.

redeemAuditUser.title: Redeemaudituser
redeemAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who is issuing the reward redemption.

IssueVariableReward.description: Details needed to issue a variable reward

profileId.title: Profileid
profileId.description: Profile ID of the member. In an ecosystem, it acts as a primary ID to keep the various systems (apps, websites, etc.) in sync.

locationExternalReference.title: Locationexternalreference
locationExternalReference.description: External reference ID (or name) of the location where the points are being redeemed.

amountToRedeem.title: Amounttoredeem
amountToRedeem.description: The dollar amount being redeemed. The maximum amount which can be redeemed (or the reward limit) is configurable. When a member has $100 in their loyalty account and the store has a reward limit of $50, they can use two rewards certificates to redeem the amount fully.

issueAuditUser.title: Issueaudituser
issueAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who is issuing the reward.

tierDiscountValue.title: Tierdiscountvalue
tierDiscountValue.description: Tier-based discounts can be offered by attaching members to different tiers, such as silver, gold, platinum, etc. The discount percentage or discount amounts can be customized.

profileId.title: Profileid
profileId.description: Profile ID of the member. In an ecosystem, it acts as a primary ID to keep the various systems (apps, websites, etc.) in sync.

redemptionCode.title: Redemptioncode
redemptionCode.description: Redemption code to identify and link the rewards used in a specific transaction. This code is generated in the response of the 'Issue Variable Rewards' endpoint - POST /api/v1/redeem/reward/issue.

pointsToRedeem.title: Pointstoredeem
pointsToRedeem.description: The number of points to be redeemed.

pointCost.title: Pointcost
pointCost.description: Ratio of dollar value of reward to the points being redeemed. E.g. a value of 0.5 indicates that 1 dollar redeemed consumed 2 points.

status.title: Status
status.description: Status of the reward. E.g. Active or Redeemed

amountToRedeem.title: Amounttoredeem
amountToRedeem.description: The dollar amount to be redeemed. The maximum amount to be redeemed (or the reward limit) is configurable. When a member has $100 in their loyalty account and the store has a reward limit of $50, they can use two rewards certificates to redeem the amount fully.

redeemLocationExternalReference.title: Redeemlocationexternalreference
redeemLocationExternalReference.description: External reference (ID or name) of the location where the rewards were redeemed.

redeemedTimestamp.title: Redeemedtimestamp
redeemedTimestamp.description: Date of redemption, in UTC format.

merchantId.title: Merchantid
merchantId.description: Merchant ID. If configured, it is returned in the response.

issueAuditUser.title: Issueaudituser
issueAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who issued the rewards.

redeemAuditUser.title: Redeemaudituser
redeemAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who redeemed the rewards.

cancelAuditUser.title: Cancelaudituser
cancelAuditUser.description: Name of the representative who cancelled the rewards.

eligibleRevenue.title: Eligiblerevenue
eligibleRevenue.description: Revenue generated from the items in a transaction that are configured as 'eligible' for earning points.

pointType.title: Pointtype
pointType.description:
Point type. Categorized as:
1) Base points - Earned in any purchase transaction based on the core rule.
2) Bonus points - Earned as a bonus for example on a large purchase.
3) Promotional Points - Earned as part of promotional events.
4) Restricted Points - Points to be used only on specific entity/stores.

subType.title: Subtype
subType.description: Subtypes of the points (configurable, if required).

memberPointsEarned.title: Memberpointsearned
memberPointsEarned.description: Represents the total points earned by this member.

memberPointsDeducted.title: Memberpointsdeducted
memberPointsDeducted.description: Represents the total points deducted for this member.

memberPointsUsed.title: Memberpointsused
memberPointsUsed.description: Represents the total points redeemed (burned) by this member.

memberPointsExpired.title: Memberpointsexpired
memberPointsExpired.description: Represents the total points that have expired for this member.

memberPointsAvailable.title: Memberpointsavailable
memberPointsAvailable.description: Represents the total points available for use by this member.

memberPointsLocked.title: Memberpointslocked
memberPointsLocked.description: Represents the restricted points that can be used only at a specific entity/store.

points.title: Points
points.description: The number of unrestricted points of this particular point-type.

pointType.title: Pointtype
pointType.description:
The type of points. Categorized as:
1) Base points - Earned in any purchase transaction, based on the core rule.
2) Bonus points - Earned as a bonus for example on a large purchase.
3) Promotional Points - Earned as part of promotional events.

totalPoints.description: Total number of unrestricted points (Base + Bonus + Promotional).

totalCurrencyValue.title: Totalcurrencyvalue
totalCurrencyValue.description: Monetary value of the unrestricted points.

pointTypeName.title: Pointtypename
pointTypeName.description:
Point types. Categorized as:
1) Base points - Earned in any purchase transaction based on the core rule.
2) Bonus points - Earned as a bonus for example on a large purchase.
3) Promotional Points - Earned as part of promotional events.
4) Restricted Points - Points to be used only on specific entity/ stores.
